overview:
Gerard F. Corbett is a senior branding, marketing and PR executive with 40 years experience in a broad range of global technology, industrial and consumer product and service companies. He currently serves as Founder and CEO of Redphlag LLC, CMO of Producers Forum, Inc., Chair and CEO of the Public Relations Society of America and chief coach at the PRJobCoach. He previously was Vice President and General Manager of the Americas for the Branding and Corporate Communications Group of Hitachi, Ltd., one of the world’s leading electronics companies. He was charged with managing the company’s global web presence and overseeing a broad range of corporate brand, marketing and public relations functions for Hitachi in the Americas.

Corbett has served as head of corporate communications for a number of Fortune 200 firms including Loral Corporation, the former defense electronics company, acquired by Lockheed Martin; ASARCO Incorporated, an integrated nonferrous miner and metals producer; and Gould Inc., a diversified international electronics company, which was acquired by Japan Energy in 1988. Previously he worked for International Harvester Company, where he had responsibility for technology, employee and executive communications. He also was a senior account executive for the public relations firm of Creamer Dickson Basford in Providence, Rhode Island, where he handled a number of technology and industrial accounts. Gerry also served as a senior technical and software writer for Four Phase Systems, Inc. and National Semiconductor Corporation, and a scientific programmer at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) in Mountain View, Calif.
